title: Pressure - fluid layers in triangular container

content.question: Three fluids are poured into a triangular container, as shown. The fluids separate into three layers, with thicknesses of the layers indicated in the figure. The absolute pressure at the boundary between Fluid <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and Fluid <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="P sub A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> and the absolute pressure at the boundary between Fluid <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and Fluid <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is <math alttext="P sub B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="P sub A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>BC</mi></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub A B is less than P sub B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>BC</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="P sub A B equals P sub B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>BC</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="P sub A B is greater than P sub B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>BC</mtext></msub></math>
The comparison cannot be made without knowing the relative densities of the fluids.
